You should be able to give supplements through the feeding tube without any issues. You will need a pill crusher and some medicine syringes. Crush pills up and mix them with a little water or juice and you should be fine. For gel pills, you will need to squeeze the supplement out and mix with a little warm water for best results. If you are giving supplements to a child make sure you are only buying children supplement and not adult. This will ensure you are giving child appropriate doses. If the person is taking any kind of medication, please check with a doctor or pharmacist first to check for any possible interaction. And before taking some supplements, you should have your levels check before consuming. Always use common sense and proper safety precautions. And never stop taking your medicine because you feel a supplement
is a better replacement or alternative. It might be. But until you are medically cleared under a doctors order, you should continue your meds. Tip shared by Mom Tiffany Coleman
